sub_topic: The Mandelbrot set and its fractal properties
message_1: What is the area of the main cardioid in the Mandelbrot set? Round your answer to the nearest hundredth.
message_2:
The main cardioid in the Mandelbrot set is the largest connected region in the set, and it has a shape similar to a heart. The area of the main cardioid can be calculated using the formula:

Area = (1/2) * π * (5/4)

Area ≈ 1.9635

Rounded to the nearest hundredth, the area of the main cardioid in the Mandelbrot set is approximately 1.96 square units.
